meanings.sent1: She gave the light switch a flick to turn off the lights.
meanings.sent2: The cat caught the bug with a quick flick of its paw.
meanings.sent3: With a flick of her wrist, she tossed the paper airplane into the air.
meanings.sent4: The dancer's flick of the wrist added grace to her performance.
meanings.sent5: The flick of the butterfly's wings created a gentle breeze.

meanings.definition: To propel or remove with a quick movement
meanings.sent1: He used his finger to flick the crumb off the table.
meanings.sent2: She flicked the light switch on and the room brightened.
meanings.sent3: The chef expertly flicked the vegetables in the pan.
meanings.sent4: The magician flicked the coin into the air, dazzling the audience.
meanings.sent5: The soccer player flicked the ball past the goalie and scored a goal.

meanings.definition: A quick, light blow or stroke
meanings.sent1: He felt a flick on his shoulder and turned to see who it was.
meanings.sent2: The boxer dodged the opponent's flick and counterattacked.
meanings.sent3: The playful flick on the nose made him giggle.
meanings.sent4: The flick of the paintbrush added detail to the artwork.
meanings.sent5: The flick of the tail showed the cat's annoyance.

meanings.definition: To activate or turn on with a quick movement
meanings.sent1: She flicked the light switch and the room was illuminated.
meanings.sent2: He flicked the remote control to turn on the TV.
meanings.sent3: The child flicked the toy car to make it move forward.
meanings.sent4: With a flick of the wrist, he turned on the blender.
meanings.sent5: She flicked the ignition key and the engine roared to life.
